body.p: It was reported to me some time ago, that you had goodnaturedly declared you would like to “go on” in the Play,The Frozen Deep by Wilkie Collins; performed in Jan 57 at Tavistock House: see Pilgrim Letters 8. for the fun of being in it. If this should be really so, and you do not object to become a Mute Seaman,As one of the crews of the Sea Mew and Wanderer, iced-in in the Arctic Regions, in Act II: see also To Jones, 12 June. “an eligible opportunity now offers”.Imitating newspaper advertisements, for vacancies in clerical and professional employment. A Seaman is summoned to Sheffield,Edward Hogarth, Catherine’s youngest brother, due to play Bateson; employed in a business house in Sheffield threatened by failure: To Thomas Hankey, 11 Dec 57, Pilgrim Letters 8, p. 491. and another Seaman (the speechless one) is ill. Unidentified We rehearse tonight at 1⁄4 before 8, for the last time before the Dress Rehearsal on Monday.
